faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about the PESEL number
faq.q1Answer: The PESEL number is a unique identifier assigned to each resident in Poland. It is used for administrative, medical, and tax procedures.
faq.q2Answer: All residents in Poland, including foreigners with a temporary or permanent residence permit, need a PESEL number.
faq.q3Title: How long does the process take?
faq.q3Answer: Normally, the process of obtaining the PESEL number takes between 2 and 4 weeks from the submission of the complete application.
faq.q4Answer: You will need your passport, residence permit (if applicable), lease agreement or proof of address in Poland, and in some cases, a birth certificate.
